website_summaries.verdict: This charger’s built-in ammeter gives users at-a-glance output readings. Performance in variable conditions makes it an incredible value.
pros: Adequate amperage to charge multiple devices fast
Included ammeter provides instant output reading
cons: Clips for attaching to backpack are a bit flimsy
Reports of charger failing after a few weeks/months of use
Carrying case is weather-resistant, not waterproof

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointing. Was expecting to get some higher current from this under full sunlight. As others had mentioned, there are different versions of this and I have the new one. It seems to max out at about 3.5 amps, which is about 18 watts. It is rated for 28Watts, which should be closer to 5.5 amps. Also, this would not charge at least 2 large battery packs that I own. It charges individual phones perfectly fine. Not sure what the problem there is.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Blosser

customer_reviews.title: Stopped With Less Than 5 Uses?!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for less than a month and used less than 5 times. Sadly, it is not charging any longer. I hope this is an isolated break down of the product and no one else experiences this. I am in a southern state and it is in direct sunlight with minimal clouds when attempting to charge.
customer_reviews.author: DocLewis

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this solar charger. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this solar charger. I placed my iPhone inside the pouch as directed and checked on it a mere 5 minutes later. It already had a high temperature warning (pouch is not insulated and is colored black). So I unplugged it, cooled it off, and when I plugged it back in, I put it inside my separate insulated cooler instead. Despite a full hour of charging in full sun, the battery now stated it was at a lower charge level than when I began!
customer_reviews.author: Evan S.

customer_reviews.title: Was only able to get 0. 7 amps max ...
customer_reviews.text: Was only able to get 0.7 amps max of charging. Mostly 0.4 to 0.5. I live in Florida tested it on a hot sunny day twice same results. Also bought an USB voltage amp meter to confirm. Same results.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Product ! I got the bad one...
customer_reviews.text: It is best of all products in Solar Chargers. Tested in cloudy environment under low sunlight and it still charges my Iphone. Glad that I bought it. I would like to change my reviews here. I tried using the same item today in bright sunlight here a Kendall Park, NJ on 17th Jan, 2019. around 11:15 AM. I kept it out for nearly an hour. My iphone battery was 15% and after an hour when I went to see the charge, it nearly dropped down to 2% instead of charging up, it drained up my Iphone. Sorry to say..I am utterly disappointed and going to return back my product.
customer_reviews.author: Mihir Joshi

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works. I have an Android Note 4 and it does charge it up. Takes a while to charge it, but it does. I find that on a sunny day, if I'm outside taking lots of videos with my phone, that this charger will keep up the charge while recording. My old Note 4 dies quick when recording video, but this charger keeps it going.
customer_reviews.author: SickOfBluray

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time/money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for a military training exercise in the middle of death valley during the month of july/august. Couldn't get much more sunlight if I traveled there myself. Charger was terrible would take a solid two/three days to fully charge a si ply ipod or phone. Much cheaper solar charges here that include batteries that hold a charge unlike this model.
customer_reviews.author: Brina

customer_reviews.title: No charge
customer_reviews.text: After three days in the sun, there was still zero charge! Was I missing something about how solar chargers work, or does this company have problems with quality control?
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed; Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for 2 weeks. Charged my iPhone 6s plus from 8% to 99% in less than 2 hours. Then tried it (safely secured to my backpack) and it did not work at all, phone went from 40% to 38%. The charging meter showed 0.1 or 0 when exposed to sun at an angle. Aligned all 4 panels of the charger on a solid surface directly at the sun on a full sun day and meter registered 0.1 or 0; it simply stopped working. Will try a replacement, but very skeptical at this point. I do not want to rely on this charger in a remote location when it has already failed once.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: This is not 28 watt solar charger, more like 15 watt charger
customer_reviews.text: If this was truly 28 watts solar charger, I should get around 5.6 amps but in real reality, I'm getting under 3 amps under full sun. They even said that max output amp is 4, if this is case this item is 20 watt charger. Why lie about it? I use this secondary solar charger, and overall it is ok. It would of been nice if they accurately label their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff for the price. . .in direct sunlight, each USB port puts out about as much power as newer phone charger ("turbo charging," etc.) That is, it charges my Galaxy S8 as fast as a good wall charger. Pretty well made, folds up nicely. Note that it won't show output (often?) without something connected; I get maximum output with two USB devices plugged in. Does need pretty direct sun for best performance.
customer_reviews.author: B. Barna

customer_reviews.title: Product failed after only running a few test.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the 3 times I actually used it. Unfortunately The product when in direct sunlight half sun or any light just always displays 0 amps I’m not sure if maybe the hardware malfunctioned or it was not put together correctly, product was never exposed to any elements other then testing then testing it for a survival pack, this is one heavy paperweight I think I’ll end up ditching.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond H. Cancel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I am a boy scout leader. I purchased this product so that I could charge my cell phone while at camp for the week. Not only did this solar panel fully charge by 3700mah cell phone, it also topped off my battery charger. Of course, we had plenty of sun. Using the carabiner and the grommet holes on the panel, I was able to easily hang the solar panel from our canopy. The digital display was really handy, as it helped me to adjust the panel to the correct angle.
customer_reviews.author: Beth A. Morley

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Under full Florida sun at noon, I am able to pull about 2.8 Amps max. In complete cloud cover, I can get 0.5-0.8 Amps. Everything solar is rated at its best-case scenario so I'm very pleased to get almost 3 Amps on a single USB port. I can charge up a 10,000 MAh power bank in about 4-5 hours. About the same as a wall outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris lane

customer_reviews.title: Great charging unit for campers
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this solar charger at first, never really having used one before. This unit was awesome. I went on a week long camping trip with no access to electricity and this unit kept mine and my husbands phones charged with no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Wright

customer_reviews.title: off-grid charging of my iPhone X
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a waterproof method of charging my cell phone when I'm camping, hiking, etc. I particularly like the 'charge meter' which indicates if any power (expressed in amperes) is going into the phone. Instruction say it will charge my tablet and laptop also. Purchased item 2 months ago and works well so far. Hasn't been exposed it to rain yet so I can't verify if it is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Jos Stark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing solar bag
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is really an amazing solar bag. Nice craft, durable canvas sewed firmly with solar panel, you don't need to worry drop or something. And it have metal hook, easy to hang on while outdoors. I've used many times, it didn't disappoint me. I can read the current number through screen,easily charging for my loving phone, tablet. it charge very fast, done good job. My phone and date cable could be hide inside bag. It could also recognize iphone or ipad with intelligent identification chip, really great!
customer_reviews.author: jersyf

customer_reviews.title: Charges fast, both ports don’t work
customer_reviews.text: It charges one device at a time great. On a really sunny day here in Texas summer I can almost fully charge my IPhone in an hour but if I plug my watch or something into the second port everything seems to stop. Maybe it’s just my device that’s defective or it’s just not capable I’m not sure. No problems with durability it seems really solid and well put together. Easy to travel with and charges one device surprisingly well even in lower light. I still rate it high because of how impressed I am with the charging speed.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Completely failed to meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: We live in Colorado, with a guaranteed full-sun days for 300 days a year. If a solar charger can't cut the mustard out here, it can't anywhere. I tried to charge an Anker battery pack on 2 different bright and cloudless days. On one day after 8 hours the battery back had gained only 1 out of 4 bars, on the second day it gained no bars.
customer_reviews.author: Rationalitarian

customer_reviews.title: Great BUT....
customer_reviews.text: This unit works well HOWEVER I am giving it 4 stars because the digital readout is IMPOSSIBLE to read in sunlight!! It is a red LED display. The manufacturer needs to replace it with a READABLE display that is an LCD to receive 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Critic123

customer_reviews.title: Good for hurricane Irma
customer_reviews.text: Just got it due to Hurricane Irma. When I tried it out in the sun, received message on iPhone that the product was not supported. It did charge the iPhone when the sun was bright enough. Good for power when electricity not working.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cushing

customer_reviews.title: Electronics did not hold up to the wind
customer_reviews.text: It was a windy day but not terrible and the wind caused electronics holding the display to break off of the cloth and the black wire separated from the solder so it is no longer functional. I purchased this in June 2019 and was hoping it would be more durable than it turned out to be.
customer_reviews.author: mtk

customer_reviews.title: Reliability and Quality is a MUST for item like this.  The intention to have this is for emergency.
customer_reviews.text: When it works it is great. I can achieved 3.6A charging with both inputs and both of my devices were limit to each with 2.0A Max inputs. I have trying this out on a daily basics since i bought it. It works fine up until today which was the last day of the return windows. It went dead and not charging the same 2 power bank after 4 hours. The meter shown zero. So i took the pictures with a device to show that it is dead. I am glad it dies today and still within the return window.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect to get anywhere near the advertised 28W even in full sun.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect the advertised 28W. Full direct sun, no clouds or shade, and could only get 0.6W. It could slowly charge 1 cell phone, but barely.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine J. Larimer

customer_reviews.title: Reading the power display, in the sunlight, or returning the item, for a full refund...
customer_reviews.text: I do like the charging unit, but one of the reasons I bought the unit was because it displayed the power going into the devices, that were being charged. The problem is that it is very difficult to red the display while in the sunlight, or even when it is cloudy. And this is a solar charger, meaning that it needs sunlight to work, and that is when I need to see the display. If a solution is not able to be presented, then I will need to return the item, and search for another solar charger. Thank you...
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Reliable product
customer_reviews.text: Took it camping and I was a little skeptical about the charging capabilities of it. I am giving it a 4 star on charging power just because it takes a little too long to charge a single power cell even though it was facing the sun the whole time. It did charge it more than 75% which was adequate to my needs so I am not upset at all. It was light weight and hardly notice it while it was attached to my backpack. Love this purchase and I will probably buy another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Celso

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this didn't work for me at all. It lit up and I had bright sun (I was right on the equator) but every time I would check if my phone was charging, the battery would be lower. I think I most likely just had a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Hendo

customer_reviews.title: Good charger
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mainly for backpacking trips so that I can keep my Garmin & cell phone charged. Garmin for obvious reasons and cell phone since that is my only camera. I have been pretty amazed that even in low light it still is able to charge at a decent rate. It does seem to be a little finicky at times with the charging rate but simply unplugging the device attached to it and replugging it back in seems to correct it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Powerful power to go!
customer_reviews.text: Got this right before a 2 day road trip. It charged well sitting on my dash board and I was able to charge my phone 3 times without recharging it. It still had 47% after 3 S7 charges. Amazing. This will be a must have on all my trips. Highly recommended and I'm impressed with the rubberized, armored case. Should be very durable! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: This thing never came up to 4Aand then failed on me during a 7 week trip to a remote corner of Nepal. It was actually sucking power out of my camera in full sun at 16,000 ft. at noon!!! No product support from big blue either, as an email came back as undelivered. Bottom line : poor product, no customer support. Don't buy it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this things.
customer_reviews.text: This is my seccond unit, I use it to charge a few of the larger battery banks I use to power all my sub devices, phones, speakers, lights, headphones, fans, keyboards and mice, ps4 controllers, Nintendo switch. With 2 I find it more than capable of charging these batteries in a few hours. specially the double input batteries. I love the amp meter and can’t go back to another one that doesn’t have this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo De Ycaza

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable charging in clear skies over a week.
customer_reviews.text: Took this to the Nevada desert with clear skies and the charger would charge very inconsistently. In broad noon daylight, fully unfolded (I read the instructions), the amp meter would read 0.0. Sometimes I could read a charge, and I was able to sporadically power some devices, but on the whole, I was disappointed with the performance of what seemed like an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Heimerman

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Emergency Power for Small Devices
customer_reviews.text: I have been sending these to family and friends in Puerto Rico. Reports are that they work great to charge cell phones and tablets. I have been having trouble sending larger Lithium rechargeable batteries to make them more efficient, but the solar panels are certainly doing the job. They are easy to set up even for people who are not great with technology.
customer_reviews.author: PMC

customer_reviews.title: Best one I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I used a few of these "types" of panels while deployed overseas. I have to say this is the best one I have used. It works great in cloud cover and complete overcast. Charges fast while exposed to direct sunlight. I would buy again. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gern B.

customer_reviews.title: it's great. But next time
customer_reviews.text: Listed said it was water proof (like, from splashes or rain), but when I got it, the instructions clearly state that it cannot get wet at all. This item is also no longer available it seems from this seller and I am not able to return it, as solar panels are considered to be hazardous materials. Otherwise, it's great. But next time, I'd pay the extra $3-$5 to get one that's actually waterproof, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Q.

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I’m very impressed with the quality and performance of this solar panel. It charges faster than I expected and is more durable than expected. I have dropped this thing from a good 40-50ft onto concrete and no damage. I can charge my IPhone XS Max in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this solar panel did not get five stars is because I just haven’t had it long enough to say it’s a five star item. I have had zero issues on many successful missions and even did over a month without a wall plug in. Charging a phone, a Bluetooth speaker, tablet and a vape without ever being totally out of battery.... Might I suggest portable battery banks instead of straight from solar panel to phone
customer_reviews.author: Micah Galbraith

customer_reviews.title: Thought itd be a great idea to have for emergency situations
customer_reviews.text: Thought itd be a great idea to have for emergency situations, however very dissapointed that no instructions exsisted. Still don't think I've got it working to its fullest potential after two days in the blaring sun.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: charged very slowly
customer_reviews.text: I used it when I went to the beach, but not seeing it charged the speed I was expected. Actually, I didn't notice my phone was charged at all. If you expect your phone will die a little bit slower, this is the right one, but if you are expecting your phone will be fully charged when you are sitting at the beach, it'll never happen.
customer_reviews.author: tom h.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I received this panel last week. I started charging my Iphone X, and a battery at the same time. I had direct sunlight with no clouds for the first part. while I had cloudless skies, my phone charged at 1% per minute about the same as being plugged into the wall with a standard charger. when clouds moved in, the unit dropped to charging about 0.3% per minute. I am happy with this result. I will update this review for weather resistance after I have used it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected.
customer_reviews.text: The screen on the ammeter came in scratched up. High noon in August, on a perfectly blue day, I only got 0.5 running on this thing. Vastly off the promised mark. There was no excuse for the poor output as conditions were as good as it gets. I've seen videos where the conditions were worse and output was as described so I'm guessing this one was defective. Maybe a re-packaged return. I'll use the warranty to get another one but its too little too late for this summer's camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a total waste of money. How this piece of crap got over a one star is beyond me. In direct sunlight it will not get over .7 amps. Save your money and look else where.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than two months...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and was disappointed that it stopped working after not even two months of use. Went to BigBlue website for technical support and their site is a joke. I feel scammed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B

customer_reviews.title: Optimise productivity.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product and soon reading the reviews I want to clear up some issues people are having. First thing to know is that the amp matter is measuring the feedback from your charging computer / battery and somebody said it should be 5.4 amps but it's 4 amps because you need to generate more wattage then you use when powering computers/high tec batteries .
customer_reviews.author: Janewoodfall

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let it in the sun for too long
customer_reviews.text: The product works well until... it gets too hot and it stops charging. From 2.2 to 0.4 even under a cloudless sky. Put it away, let it cool down and it works fine until it gets too hot. Spring time here and 8am sun makes it too hot in 20 min. Not happy and poor quality
customer_reviews.author: s demichelis

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, but probably good for hurricane season.
customer_reviews.text: I returned it because I definitely did not expect it to be a portable tent. I was looking for something simple and lightweight. It was too complicated for me to deal with. If I have to read instructions it's too complicated. I'll try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Resumehouse1936

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I used the Big Blue to charge my cell phone (an old Samsung S6) and my Huawei Power Bank 10000mAh. I also like the Digital Ammeter it has.... I keep using my other charger (Neckteck 20 W... 3 folding panels). Although I am very happy with that one, definitely having a charger with 4 folding panels works faster. As for every mobile phone or power bank, I suggest to hide the equipment from the sun. Only the solar panels should be under direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Bettina Chian

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this unit. It charged my Samsung Note from dead to 100% in less than 4 hours. I cannot tell you exactly how long cause I was not expecting it to be so fast. My only issue is that the phone overheated while it was in the pouch. They should have made it a web instead of fabric. After all it has a hole in the top of the pouch for the cord so it really is not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: tmac

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Portable, and Delivers lots of power
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Super portable, but still delivers a good bit of juice. Have left it outside during a rain with no problem. Love the ammeter display.
customer_reviews.author: jh815

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for one road trip. Died shortly thereafter.
customer_reviews.text: I used this occasionally for a month on a road trip. I got home, gently put it in a storage bin with other camping gear and when I pulled it out months later it was dead. The display turns on when it is in the sun, but does not charge and reads 0.0
customer_reviews.author: Colin Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Charges faster than my fast charging wall plugs in direct sunlight. It can charge my iPhone or Android with no comparability issues and the displayed output is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works very effectively. It is robustly made and lightweight. Ideal for recharging just about anything with a USB charging port I'd say. All panels need to be unrolled and exposed to sun for it to function. However even on a somewhat cloudy day it still delivers a charge. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Skagit Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly quick charge
customer_reviews.text: Replacing a smaller Goal Zero Nomad solar charger which was too slow - first charge using Bigblue on a Los Angeles spring morning and was very pleased with how quickly it charged my iPhone. Will be a great addition for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G. Eklund

customer_reviews.title: Anywhere charging
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping. Only used for a short time but seemed to put out rated power and had no issue charging my iPhone. Pretty impressed with it for the cost. No long term review yet but a good item to have laying around in a vehicle for an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Barri Cornwall

customer_reviews.title: Great for military.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is in the army and I bought this for him for the field. He uses it for his rechargeable battery for his cellphone and his cellphone itself. He never has to worry about either going dead again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily K

customer_reviews.title: never charged
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, left in sun for over 10 hours and it never charged. returned it. Perhaps a fault unit but seemed worthless
customer_reviews.author: JMT

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: Charging both android and iphone. Both kept showing charger disconnected and connected every few seconds. Charging under direct sunlight in a sunny afternoon. Starting charge was about 50 percent. After charging for 1 hour, the battery of both phones reduced to about 40 percent... Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jianfang Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Houston bright sun 85+ F
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? yes, is output 4 amp, no way. 85+ F. Bright Sun. Note 4. Turned off GPS, blue tooth, screen rotation, only amp output 1-1.3 amps. I think this is normal but disappointing. It charged 20% in 1 hr. I will keep it for now. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: LINTON

customer_reviews.title: Big Blue folding solar panel
customer_reviews.text: Charged my power bank ,rechargeable batterys and cell phone about the same speed as the home chargers . I bought it for a bugout/go bag if the power ever go's out I should still be able to keep somethings running like lights .
customer_reviews.author: Archer1012

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t seem to work very well.
customer_reviews.text: It was bought February 2020. I get 2.1 amp charging initially, but it drops off after about 10 minutes to approximately 0.3 amp charging. I am charging an Anker 20100 battery. 2 to 10 feet charge cable. Length does not appear to matter. If I unplug and plug back in, the 2.1 charging starts back up for another 10 minutes. Stable constant bright, cloudless sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce G. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and compact. Easy to pack or hang on the back of a pack
customer_reviews.text: My son took this on 2 scouting trips this summer: one to New Mexico and one to West Virginia. Kept his phone and camera charged through 4 weeks of camping and hiking in the back country without a noticable weight addition.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Cotner

customer_reviews.title: Using the power of the sun for my first time
customer_reviews.text: Currently powering at 0.3 amps and 3.7V. I wish it was more powerful, but it depends on sunlight position & strength. I’m just happy of using the power of the sun. Even if it’s not that powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Favela Tentori

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This unit seems to work great so far and has a three headed adapter for most of the electron devices I use. I zip tie it on the back of my hunting pack and now I don’t have to worry about carrying lots of batteries or leaving my GPS on overnight
customer_reviews.author: Jon K

customer_reviews.title: Won’t charge iPhone 6s in full direct sunlight
customer_reviews.text: I dont usually leave reviews but this thing is just terrible. In full Texas summer sun in the middle of the day this thing only got 0.2 amps and wouldn’t even charge my iPhone 6s. Was really hoping to take this on my big hiking trip soon but now it’s just dead weight. Don’t waste your money :(
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Downen

customer_reviews.title: Will quickly pay for itself!
customer_reviews.text: It charges my usb rechargeable lights quickly. I’ve seen charging currents like 2.8 amps while it is spread out on our picnic table connected to 3 flashlights. I use it daily to charge something including Arlo cameras, work lights, bug zappers, and rechargeable 123 batteries. I plan to buy a second one to keep in my motorhome.
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after 3 days
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for 3 days. Then suddenly it just stopped giving power. The highest was 0,1 on the screen. I have a feeling that it is a faulty product and I feel cheated. I would like a refund as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Rehi

customer_reviews.title: Great value, durable, and fast!
customer_reviews.text: This is the main staple in my camping/survival bag. I only used it once to test it and it fully charged my dead mp3 player in just 15-20 minutes (I wasn't watching it too see when it finished) and I'm sure it would have no problem charging up your phone or other devices based on other reviewers posts. It is made from very high quality materials and seems to be cushioned well against accidental bumps or short drops.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wise

customer_reviews.title: Great when camping to keep devices and lanterns charged
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to keep devices charged when we went camping which made my 2 teenage boys happy that they could use they're phones at night to watch videos and our 10 yr old son happy he could use his tablet at night because everything was charged by this amazing solar charger. My wife and my phones were also able to be charged as well as our headlamps and camping lanterns.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Neal

customer_reviews.title: This did not charge my phone in three days time
customer_reviews.text: I had great hoped for this Solar charger but it never charged my phone in over 3 days time with pretty much all day sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: dano59

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had the charger for a week now, and so far it has worked great (even in relatively low winter light). It's more than capable of charging a phone battery within 2-3 hours, even placed inside a window. If you want a good solar charger (capable of charging purely based on solar energy), I would highly recommend this product (or something similar) in lieu of the smaller, cheaper solar chargers/battery packs.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Ammeter Great Feature
customer_reviews.text: The ammeter acknowledges charging level and foldable pad can be hung vertically to follow best light source.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ressler

customer_reviews.title: Worked great when the sun was out on my backpacking trip
customer_reviews.text: Worked great when the sun was out on my backpacking trip. If you can't read the display you're in good sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

product_meta.title: BigBlue 28W Solar Charger with Digital Ammeter, 2USB(5V/4A Max Overall), Portable Waterproof Solar Panels Phone Charger Compatible with iPhone 11/Xs/XR/X/8, iPad, Samsung Galaxy, LG, Google Pixel etc.
feature_bullets: Built-in Ammeter: The ammeter can measure the current in a circuit. The value of Amps of our 28W solar charger depends on your devices, sunlgiht intensity and cable used. If your device has an input current of 1A (such as the iPhone), the amount of ammeter will show between 0.8A and 1A in theory.

Exclusive SmartIC Technology: With the built-in intelligence chip, our solar phone charger can detects your device then deliver its fastest possible charging speed(single usb port up to 5V/2.4A Max, dual USB ports up to 4A Max overall). Dual-port applys to all the 5V Android devices and apple devices. Note: This solar charger is not compatible with the iPad Pro.

High Efficiency: SunPower Solar Panels with high solar conversion efficiency by up to 21.5% - 23.5%. With compact size (11.1 × 6.3× 1.3in folded) and lightweight (21.0 oz) design, includes 4 clip hooks, which allows you to hook your solar panel everywhere convenient to get solar access (trees, backpacks, vehicle, etc.), so it is easy to carry for any outdoor activities such as camping, climbing, fishing etc.

Special PET Polymer Surface: Industrial-strength PET polymer fabric protects your solar panel and your devices from occasional rain or wet fog. IPX4 waterproof level, but the USB ports and ammeter are not water-resistant, so keep them away from water while charging. the pocket with a zip will keep your devices safe and clean while camping.

Easy to Use: Please unfold four solar panels under outdoor direct sunlight( No cloud and no shadow), then connect your device to the usb port with your certificated cable. A usb cable is provided in our package and not included the lighting cable. Note: Please don't place the device inside the pocket attached when charging in order to avoid overheating then damage your devices.
